Class GradebookGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • javax.swing.JApplet
              • GradebookGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer

    public class GradebookGUI
extends javax.swing.JApplet
    This class implements the Gradebook graphical user interface, including the layout for each of the individal tabs and the methods that create a running instance of the program.
    Version:
    1.0 10/1/2016
    Author:
    Gabriel Miller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function that calls GradebookGUI constructor
        Parameters:
        args - empty

      • prepareGUI

        public void prepareGUI()
        prepareGUI method that initializes and sets up the interface for the numerous tabs in Gradebook, as well as the generation of the login interface (which must be successfully passed in order to generate the Gradebook GUI. It also performs a number of other functions, such as calling methods for loading windows as necessary and making calls to the server in order to populate the user interface elements with the appropriate data.

      • createCourse

        public void createCourse()
        Runs when the "New Course" button is pressed. It first creates the New Course Wizard window, then takes the user inputs and creates a course in the directory. It then adds the new course to the course selector combo box in the controls panel, and displays the new course on the main page.

      • createAssignment

        public void createAssignment()
        Runs when the "New Assignment" button is pressed. It first runs the New Assignment Wizard, then takes the user inputs and creates the assignment.txt file in the "Assignments" folder for the course. It then updates the current table with the new course. Although we can move a column in a JTable after adding it, we cannot do the same with the underlying DefaultTableModel (which only allows you to append columns). Therefore, we have to calculate how many moves we must make to get from the table model to the desired JTable by getting a count of the number of courses that have been added since the last table update, and move columns back accordingly.

      • addStudent

        public void addStudent()
        Runs when the "Add Student" button is pressed. It first runs the New Student Wizard, then takes the user inputs and creates a new line in the "assignments" file on the server. It then updates the table with the new student information.

      • editRubric

        public void editRubric()
        Runs whenever the "Edit Rubric" button is pressed. It runs a wizard that provides the list of current rubric grade categories (if any) and gives the user the option to edit them or add new categories if they want.

      • generateReport

        public void generateReport(javax.swing.JTable table)
        Runs when the "Generate Report" button is pressed. It will generate a comma-separated text file containing the values of the table that is currently selelected.
        Parameters:
        table - JTable for which the CSV report will be generated

      • prepareTable

        public javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel prepareTable(java.lang.String semester,
                                                        java.lang.String course,
                                                        boolean ARCHIVE_TABLE)
        Retrieves and initializes the values for the Gradebook table. These values are retrieved by querying the "assignments" file in the database directory (which contains student names, ID numbers, and grades) and parsing the raw data in the function interatively. These values, as well as the values pulled from the "assignments_list" file (which contains a list of the assignment names) are then mapped to the DefaultTableModel which can then be applied to the JTable.
        Parameters:
        semester - the semester for which the table is being prepared
        course - the course for which the table is being prepared
        ARCHIVE_TABLE - flag that designates whether the table being created is for the archive tab or not. If true, then the entire table will be set to uneditable. Otherwise if false, just the appropriate columns and rows will be set to be uneditable.
        Returns:
        the DefaultTableModel containing the data for the new course table

      • getRowAverages

        public java.lang.Object[] getRowAverages(javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel model,
                                         boolean IS_RECALC)
        Gets the student average for each assignment based on the grades entered and instantiates a column object containing the values to be placed at the right of the table.
        Parameters:
        model - the DefaultTableModel for the course table being calculated
        IS_RECALC - flag to declare whether or not the table is being generated for the first time or if it is being recalculated after a grade update. This is important for determing the column count.
        Returns:
        an array containing the average grades for each of the students in the current gradebook

      • getColumnAverages

        public java.lang.Object[] getColumnAverages(javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel model,
                                            boolean IS_RECALC)
        Gets the class average for each assignment based on the grades entered and instantiates a row object containing the values to be placed at the bottom of the table.
        Parameters:
        model - the DefaultTableModel for the course table being calculated
        IS_RECALC - flag to declare whether or not the table is being generated for the first time or if it is being recalculated after a grade update. This is important for determing the row count.
        Returns:
        array containing the average grades for each column

      • getLetterGrades

        public java.lang.Object[] getLetterGrades(java.lang.Object[] averages)
        This function takes the individual student averages and converts them to letter grades, based on the information contained in the gradescheme file.
        Parameters:
        averages - the column of grade averages to be converted into letter grades
        Returns:
        array containing letter grades

      • prepareCourseSelector

        public javax.swing.DefaultComboBoxModel<java.lang.String> prepareCourseSelector()
        Populates the Course Selector Combo Box by pulling the course names from the current semester as specified by the user settings.
        Returns:
        the DefaultComboBoxModel containing the course names for the current semester

      • updateGrade

        public void updateGrade(javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel dtm,
                        javax.swing.event.TableModelEvent e,
                        java.lang.String course)
        Responds to the changing of a grade value in the Gradebook table. This is achieved by performing the necessary table recalculations (such as averages and course grades) while the grade is updated on the server using a separate thread in order to avoid the overhead of an SSH call.
        Parameters:
        dtm - the DefaultTableModel that represents the current course table being updated
        e - the TableModelEvent that triggers the updateGrade method
        course - the currently selected course for which the grade is being updated

      • prepareRubricPanel

        public void prepareRubricPanel(java.lang.String course)
        Sets all of the labels for the rubric panel as per the data stored on the rubric server file.
        Parameters:
        course - the current course for which the rubric should be pulled
